hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When a major negative news catalyst (e.g., regulatory, macro) causes a sharp 1-hour price drop (>3%) on elevated volume (>1.5x 20-day avg), but the subsequent 4-hour candle closes within the top 25% of its range, the initial sell-off is likely exhausted. A long entry on a break above the high of that 4-hour candle will capture a short-covering rally amplified by trapped shorts and algorithmic momentum ignition.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Sharp, news-driven drops often flush out weak hands and trigger stop-loss cascades. A quick recovery (high-range close) indicates strong absorption of selling. This creates a 'bear trap,' where late shorts are vulnerable. A break above the consolidation high triggers covering and attracts momentum algorithms, amplifying the move.
entry_conditions: 1-hour BTC candle closes down >3% on volume >1.5x 20-day average
Trigger: Next 4-hour candle closes with a close price in the top 25% of its range (High - Low)
Entry: Buy stop order placed at High of that 4-hour candle + 0.1%

exit_conditions.time_exit: Close position after 12 hours if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The mean return of this setup, measured from entry to the earlier of TP/SL/12-hour exit, is not statistically positive (p<0.05) over a sample of 50+ instances across multiple news cycles.
